intro: Sarcinula cycesis, commonly known as the common sarcinula, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Sarcinula cycesis is typically found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
